body:
I would love this feature as well. I think the basic feature request would be to support adding SequenceAnnotation objects with a span that overlaps an existing SequenceAnnotation object (which I imagine is a front-end feature).

The advanced feature (for a different issue after this is implemented) might be to nest the two labels visually or split the colors.

But overall the ability to tag a span with more than one label seems invaluable

rename.from: Annotate sentence using different labels for the same words
rename.to: Support multiple label in sequence labeling

body:
@jamesmf thank you for clarify the original request!
@pompobit thank you for your feature request. I changed the issue title for we grasp the request more explicitly.

issue.title: Feature request: Multiple labels for same selected text

labels.name: duplicate
labels.description: This issue or pull request already exists

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
### Problem
In sequence labeling, it would be useful to be able to annotate multiple labels for the same selected/highlighted text. Right now, it is not possible to do this. You cannot select the already labeled/annotated text and then select another label. Theoretically, you could create multiple projects for different types of sequence labelling. Another way to go about it would be to use sequence to sequence labelling and entering your response. However, it would be really convenient to have a feature to do multi-level labelling all at once with sequence labelling. 

![Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 10 45 44 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29761322/64030441-9caeda00-cb14-11e9-871b-16d6554b607e.png)

Here, I cannot select already labelled text, and label as 'anecdote'. 

![Screen Shot 2019-08-30 at 10 52 57 AM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29761322/64030455-9e789d80-cb14-11e9-958a-dfc73c90231a.png)

body: I'd love the feature as well.

issue.title: Improvement Idea for doccano

repository.name: doccano
repository.description: Open source annotation tool for machine learning practitioners.

issue.body:
**Please read this issue when you want to add the feature to doccano**  
**Please upvote üëç related issue that let us judge priority .**

We show üëç if someone upvote, and ü§© means over 10 vote

## Toward More Practical Annotation Tool

### Annotation

* Display
  - [ ] : Support HTML syntax in Document #35 üëç
* Filter
  - [ ] : Arrange Annotation Status and Filter by it #280 üëç
* Label
  - [ ] : Provide for setting the order of labels #816
  - [ ] : Group labels by the same color #477
  - [ ] : Support multiple kinds of label set #5 üëç
  - [x] : Display shortkey in labels selector (on Annotation page) #834
* Annotation
  - [x] : keyboard shortcut for approval button #718 üëç
  - [x] : A button to clear the markup. #631
  - [ ] : Automatically select the sequential characters in the sequence labeling task by the hover. #666
  - [ ] : Show context when annotation. #466 
* Navigation
  - [x] : Redirect to the specific page by id, not by offset. #540 üëç
  - [x] : "First" and "Last" buttons #615
* Productivity
  - [ ] : Display the who annotated the document #881
  - [x] : Support Comments when Annotating #1050
  - [ ] : Enable Stats view for non-admins #270 üëç
* Portability
  - [ ] : Project export and import #901

### Dataset

* Import/Export
  - [x] : Convert label to label-ID when exporting #295 ü§©
  - [x] : Import the exported annotation data and keep the all original info #482
  - [x] : Support JSON format (not JSONL) #454 üëç
  - [x] : Make maximum file upload (import) size configurable #708 üëç
* Management
  - [x] : Bulk Delete #523

## Toward Advanced Annotation Tool

### Task

- [ ] : Question Answering dataset #81 ü§©
- [ ] : Multiple choice question #464
- [x] : Multiple label in sequence labeling #19 ü§©
- [x] : Nested Named Entity Recognition #544 üëç
- [x] : Relation Annotation #233 üëç

### Auto-Annotation

- [ ] : Implements labeling functions (Weak Supervision) #224 ü§©
- [x] : Add Auto-labeling #191

## Toward Production Usage

* Deployment
  - [ ] : Helm chart #701 üëç
  - [x] : Support doccano v1.x on Heroku #811
* Security
  - [ ] :  [Proposal] Warn and/or fail if default admin's password hasn't been changed #857
  - [x] : Clarify how to set user own username/password in docker-compose for security #748
* Authentication
  - [ ] : Two factor authentication for admin and annotators #756
  - [ ] : Okta OIDC social login is not available #1255 üëç
  - [ ] : Google OAuth support #620 üëç
  - [ ] : LDAP-Support #560 üëç
* Annotation Workflow
  - [x] : Allow user to change another users' annotation #531 üëç
* Annotator Management
  - [ ] : Allow to assign more than one role in a project. #537
  - [ ] : Enhance Statistics: Compare Annotators #114 üëç
* Accessibility
  - [x] : Multiple language interface #479

body:
Would this require much of anything beyond removing parts of the validation here?

https://github.com/doccano/doccano/blob/4e25f169462a2d0413679beeb58c95b532616d14/frontend/components/organisms/annotation/EntityItemBox.vue#L191-L201

If someone knowledgeable (read: not me) about front end stuff/vue could sketch out a high level overview of how someone might get a POC out it might stimulate one of us to take a stab at it.
